answers.answer: I'm 5'8" and started out my first pregnancy at 208. I got down to 200 and then up to about 255. I had a drug free labor and vaginal delivery. My blood pressure was a little high but we watched it and it never got dangerous. This time I started art 225 and got down to 200. I'm twenty two weeks and am still down about ten pounds from where I started. My goal is gradual weight gain and only getting to a max of 240 this time!

I am 5'9" and was 250 sadly. I've actually lost 11 lbs because of morning sickness. Only 16 weeks though so here's hoping. The only thing that's really been a problem for me is having to do vaginal ultrasound in the beginning cuz of my extra padding. I'm worried about gestational diabetes because that's what happened to my mom and then it turned into type 1 I think? Or is that type 2 when you aren't born with it? Haha, regardless, it is a little riskier but with technology these days, you should be fine.  Hang in there mama!

Oh I know I'm hoping for no GD!!! :/ that would definitely suck. It's actually kinda rare for it to turn into diabetes after pregnancy, your poor mom! Well here's to hoping!! Lol so far my pregnancy has been perfectly fine, so I'm trying to stay calm lol. I had a couple days where my bp was a little high, but nothing dangerous.

With my first i gained 80 lbs, and became over weight . I had no health complications or delivery probs. My daughter my healthy. For this pregrancy im in the same boat as you.  I started over weight and already gained 25 lbs. Luckily only health issue i have is anemia. I eat healthy, walk ten min a day, advoid junk food n only drink water. It's all what u eat and if ur active. Im worried about developing high blood pressure/ diabetes, but i passed both blood work

I'm 5' 3" and I started at 206 lb and now weigh 217 at 36+5 weeks. My blood pressure is beautiful, so is all the other stuff they check for. I may be overweight but I have had a super healthy pregnancy. My Dr. never said anything about my weight or anything, but my plan is to definitely lose weight after I have this baby lol I hate being so big and was trying to lose when I found out I was pregnant

Yeah definitely! My doctor has said nothing about my weight either, just that it's good that I'm losing weight(cause baby is perfectly fine and normal size) so it's good for me! I'm just so nervous about all the risks. I guess stressing only makes things worse so I better not haha. My blood has all come back fine. No protein in my urine. Regular blood pressure. Just overweight :/ and same with me I'm losing weight as soon as I'm able to work out after birth. Haha I was a cheerleader in high school, 5'4 and 130 lbs and in great shape. IM GETTING BACK THERE. so mad at myself for even letting myself get this big :/

I started out at 250 I'm at 258. My baby weighs two pounds and is perfectly healthy. I passed my diabetes test! But I have anemia :( but that's easily taken care of. I eat normally, I just try to stay away from sweets, but I do have a sweet tooth. Point is, most overweight pregnancies turn out fine!! Don't stress and just take care of yourself for baby :)

question: I'm 25 weeks and started out pregnancy already overweight. All I see is how dangerous it is for me and baby. My plan was to lose a lot of weight before finding out I was pregnant lol. This pregnancy was completely unplanned! And now I'm worried something awful will go wrong with me and baby. Heavy women have all these risks during pregnancy and childbirth and it's scaring me to death :( any other overweight moms whose pregnancies and birth went decently?? I need to calm down!
title: Worrying :/
